Lauren_Alaina:
{{Short description|American singer and songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2021}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Lauren Alaina | image = 2023 Independence Day celebration on MCB Camp Lejeune (4) (cropped).jpg | caption = Alaina in 2023 | birth_name = Lauren Alaina Kristine Suddeth | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|11|8}} | birth_place = [[Rossville, Georgia]], U.S. | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}} | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}} | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2011–present | label = {{hlist|[[19 Recordings|19]]|[[Interscope Records|Interscope]]|[[Universal Music Group Nashville|Mercury Nashville]]|[[Big Loud]]}} |spouse = {{marriage|[[Cam Arnold February 2024]]|}} | website = {{URL|laurenalainaofficial.com}} }} '''Lauren Alaina Kristine Suddeth''' (born November 8, 1994) is an American singer and songwriter from [[Rossville, Georgia]]. She was the runner-up on the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]].'' Her debut studio album, ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]],'' was released on October 11, 2011. Her second album, ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]],'' was released January 27, 2017. Alaina later achieved her first number one on the [[Country Airplay]] chart with the album's [[Road Less Traveled (song)|title track]]. Her second number one came later that year when she simultaneously topped five ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]'' charts with her friend and former classmate [[Kane Brown]] on their duet "[[What Ifs]]". In addition to this song with Brown, Alaina became an in-demand duet vocalist throughout the next few years, appearing on number one collaborations with [[Hardy (singer)|Hardy]], [[Devin Dawson]], and [[Dustin Lynch]]. Her third studio album, ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'', was released on September 3, 2021. Alaina was a contestant on the [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 28)|twenty-eighth season]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' and placed fourth with her partner [[Gleb Savchenko]]. She is a two-time [[CMT Music Award]] winner, has received one [[Academy of Country Music Award]], and is a two-time [[Country Music Association Award]] nominee. Alaina achieved one of country music's crowning achievements when she became a [[List of Grand Ole Opry members|member]] of the [[Grand Ole Opry]] on February 12, 2022, inducted by her childhood hero [[Trisha Yearwood]]. She is currently the youngest member of the Opry. == Early life == Alaina was born on November 8, 1994, to Kristy and J. J. Suddeth of [[Rossville, Georgia]]. Her father works as a process technician in [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]].{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2011/mar/14/american-idol-fans-rally-behind-suddeth-family|title=American Idol fans rally behind Suddeth family|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=March 14, 2011|access-date=March 14, 2011}} Alaina started to sing at the age of 3. Her first public performances followed with a kids choir and an annual vacation spot that offered karaoke. She sang in church, restaurants, family holiday gatherings and anywhere within a 30-mile radius of where she lived.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/Musician-Band/LaurenAlaina/about/|title=Lauren Alaina|website=www.facebook.com}}{{failed verification|date=December 2016}} At age 8, Alaina entered the talent competition of the Southern Stars Pageant and won. The next year she was selected to perform on the Kids talent stage at Chattanooga's Riverbend Festival. She performed on that stage annually until age 12, when she won the competition that allowed her to perform on the festival's big stage. She traveled to [[Orlando, Florida]], when she was ten to compete in the American Model and Talent Competition. She won the event, beating out 1,500 kids. Alaina sang with the Georgia Country Gospel Music Association's children's group. At age 12, Alaina made her first of many trips to Nashville. She performed at local bars on Broadway, such as Tootsie's. In 2009, Alaina was the first winner of the WinniSTAR youth talent contest at [[Lake Winnepesaukah]] amusement park.{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2011/feb/21/lauren-alaina-suddeth-american-idol-success-venue|title=Polished 'Idol': Venue owners not surprised by Suddeth's success|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=February 21, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}} In addition to performing, Alaina wrote several songs including "Leaving" and "Set Me Free". Alaina was inspired to sing by her cousin, Holly Witherow, who was diagnosed with a brain tumor.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/moviestvmusic/news/5-things-you-dont-know-about-american-idols-lauren-alaina-201193|title=5 Things You Don't Know About American Idol's Lauren Alaina|last=Corneau|first=Allison|publisher=USMagazine.com|date=March 9, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}} Prior to ''Idol'', Alaina worked at [[CiCi's Pizza]]. She attended Lakeview-Fort Oglethorpe High School in [[Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia]], where she was a cheerleader.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/2011/mar/04/suddeth-advances-idol|title=Suddeth advances in 'Idol'|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=March 4, 2011|access-date=March 10, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/idol-finalist-suddeth-country-girl-heart-155125344.html|title=Idol finalist Suddeth is a 'country girl' at heart|date=March 21, 2011|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=October 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002015451/https://www.yahoo.com/news/idol-finalist-suddeth-country-girl-heart-155125344.html|url-status=dead}} Before auditioning for ''Idol'', she was rejected on ''[[America's Got Talent]]'' twice.{{Cite web|last=Powers|first=Lindsay|date=2011-05-27|title='Idol's' Lauren Alaina Once Rejected by 'America's Got Talent' (Video)|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/idols-lauren-alaina-once-rejected-192759/|access-date=2021-09-07|website=The Hollywood Reporter}} ==''American Idol''== ===Overview=== Alaina auditioned for the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'' in Nashville, Tennessee. From early on, Alaina was a judge favorite. After her audition, ''Idol'' judge [[Steven Tyler]] stated, "We found the one." May 14, 2011, was proclaimed "Lauren Alaina Day" in her hometown of Rossville, Georgia. During the season finale, Alaina sang "[[Before He Cheats]]" with her idol, [[Carrie Underwood]]. On May 25, 2011, Alaina was declared the runner-up. ===Performances and results=== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Episode !Theme !Song choice !Result |- |rowspan="2"|Audition |rowspan="2"|Auditioner's Choice |{{small|Solo}} "[[Like We Never Loved at All]]" |rowspan="2"|Advanced |- |{{small|[[Duet (music)|Duet]]}} "[[I Don't Want to Miss a Thing]]" with [[Steven Tyler]] |- |Hollywood Round, Part 1 |First Solo |"[[Unchained Melody]]" |Advanced |- |Hollywood Round, Part 2 |Group Performance |"[[Some Kind of Wonderful (Soul Brothers Six song)|Some Kind of Wonderful]]" |Advanced |- |Hollywood Round, Part 3 |Second Solo |"I Don't Want to Miss a Thing" |Advanced |- |Las Vegas Round |Songs of The Beatles

intact for another week, when two contestants were eliminated. * {{note|2|Note 2}} When [[Ryan Seacrest]] announced the results for this particular night, Alaina was in the bottom 2, but was declared safe as [[Jacob Lusk]] was eliminated. ==Music career== Following ''Idol'', Alaina was signed to [[Interscope Records]], [[Universal Music Group Nashville|Mercury Nashville]] and [[19 Recordings]]. Alaina released her single "[[Like My Mother Does]]". The song entered the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart at number 49{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/470941/scotty-mccreery-makes-historic-start-lauren-alaina-bows-on|title=Scotty McCreery Makes Historic Start, Lauren Alaina Bows On Country Songs|last=Trust|first=Gary|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=May 30, 2011|access-date=May 30, 2011}} and the [[Hot 100]] chart at number 20{{cite magazine|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2011/06/02/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-chart-debuts|title='American Idol' winners Scotty McCreery, Lauren Alaina make big Hot 100 debuts|last=Anderson|first=Kyle|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=June 2, 2011|access-date=June 2, 2011}} and sold 121,000 copies in its first week.{{cite web|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/06/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-tracks-top-the-country-chart/1|title=Scotty McCreery, Lauren Alaina tracks top country sales|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=June 1, 2011|access-date=June 1, 2011}} "Like My Mother Does" peaked at number 36 on the Hot Country Songs chart.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/306644/lauren+alaina/chart?f=357|title=Lauren Alaina Chart history – Hot Country Songs|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}} Following the conclusion of Season 10, Alaina appeared and performed on several talk shows such as ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-the-tonight-show-with-jay-leno-video.htm/|title=Lauren Alaina — The Tonight Show With Jay Leno — VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=May 27, 2011}} ''[[Live with Regis and Kelly]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-live-with-regis-and-kelly-video.htm/|title=Lauren Alaina — Live With Regis and Kelly — VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 1, 2011}} and ''[[Today (U.S. TV program)|The Today Show]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PGO-1wZJyB8| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/PGO-1wZJyB8| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina - Like My Mother Does - Today Show 06/02/11| website=[[YouTube]]|date=June 2, 2011}}{{cbignore}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8VVDFNWDCtc| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/8VVDFNWDCtc| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Scotty McCreery and Lauren Alaina - I Told You So - Today Show 06/02/11| website=[[YouTube]]|date=June 2, 2011}}{{cbignore}} On June 8, 2011, Alaina and McCreery presented at the [[CMT Music Awards]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/videos/misc/662431/2011-cmt-music-awards-american-idol-finalists-intro.jhtml?id=1665494|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110618013333/http://www.cmt.com/videos/misc/662431/2011-cmt-music-awards-american-idol-finalists-intro.jhtml?id=1665494|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 18, 2011|title=2011 CMT Music Awards -- American Idol Finalist Intro|publisher=[[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]|date=June 9, 2011}} In addition, Alaina made her [[Grand Ole Opry]] debut on June 10.{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/scotty-mccreery-lauren-alaina-make-their-opry-debut.htm|title=Scotty McCreery & Lauren Alaina Make Their Opry Debut — AUDIO — VIDEO|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 10, 2011}} She performed with [[Martina McBride]] at [[LP Field]] during the [[CMA Music Festival]].{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-martina-mcbride-duet-anyway-video/|title=Lauren Alaina Joins Martina McBride for Surprise Duet of 'Anyway' During CMA Music Fest|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|work=Taste of Country|date=June 13, 2011}} The following summer, Alaina toured with the [[American Idols Live! Tour 2011]], which began in [[West Valley City, Utah]] on July 6, 2011 and ended in [[Manila]], [[Philippines]] on September 21, 2011.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/photos/live/471825/american-idol-season-10-tour-dates-announced|title='American Idol' Season 10 Tour Dates Announced|last=Herrera|first=Monica|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=April 28, 2011}} ===2011–2012: ''Wildflower''=== [[File:Lauren Alaina in parade.jpg|Alaina in 2011|thumb|left]] On October 11, 2011, Alaina released her debut album ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]]'', which debuted at number five on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart, number two on the [[Top Country Albums|Billboard Top Country Albums]] chart, and sold 69,000 copies the first week.{{cite web|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/idolchatter/post/2011/10/lauren-alaina-scotty-mccreery-sales-debut/1|title=Lauren Alaina's 69,000 sales mean a top-five debut|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=October 19, 2011|access-date=October 19, 2011}} The album was the best-selling digital album by a debut country female. The lead single "[[Georgia Peaches]]" reached number 28 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart. To promote her album, Alaina made numerous television and radio appearances. She performed her single "Georgia Peaches" on ''[[Good Morning America]]'', ''Live with Regis and Kelly'' and ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]''. On October 22, 2011, Alaina performed at ''Opry Goes Pink'', a benefit concert at the Grand Ole Opry for ''Women for the Cure''.{{cite web|url=http://countrymusicrocks.net/2011/10/lauren-alaina-releases-wildflower-on-oct-11-with-national-media-blitz-reveals-upcoming-single.html/|title=Lauren Alaina Releases Wildflower On Oct 11 With National Media Blitz & Reveals Upcoming Single|date=October 5, 2011|publisher=Country Music Rocks|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=October 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002010646/http://countrymusicrocks.net/2011/10/lauren-alaina-releases-wildflower-on-oct-11-with-national-media-blitz-reveals-upcoming-single.html/|url-status=dead}} On November 10, 2011, Alaina performed "[[My Grown Up Christmas List]]" on ''CMA Country Christmas''.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-cma-country-christmas-my-grown-up-christmas/|title=Lauren Alaina Brightens CMA Country Christmas Special With 'My Grown Up Christmas'|last=Dunham|first=Nancy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 1, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=znZDBe9ltt0| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/znZDBe9ltt0| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina Christmas Special| website=[[YouTube]]|date=December 7, 2011}}{{cbignore}} In addition, Alaina performed for [[Barack Obama]] and [[Michelle Obama]] in the [[PBS]] special ''In Performance at the White House'' on November 21.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-coal-miners-daughter-always-on-my-mind-white-house/|title=Lauren Alaina Performs 'Coal Miner's Daughter' and 'Always on My Mind' at the White House|last=Dukes|first=Billy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=November 22, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zI5xjcx_8-g/| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111228183451/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zI5xjcx_8-g| archive-date=2011-12-28 | url-status=dead|title=Country Music: In Performance at the White House Sneak Peek: Lauren Alaina PBS|website = [[YouTube]]|date=November 22, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ESycrwzmxKk/| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/ESycrwzmxKk| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Dierks Bentley & Lauren Alaina perform "Always on My Mind" In Performance at the White House| website=[[YouTube]]|date=January 19, 2014}}{{cbignore}} She sang the National Anthem at the [[Thanksgiving]] Day game between the [[Detroit Lions]] and [[Green Bay Packers]].{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-national-anthem-thanksgiving/|title=Lauren Alaina to Sing National Anthem at Packers-Lions Thanksgiving Game|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|publisher=Taste of Country|date=November 11, 2011}} On New Year's Eve, Alaina performed her single "Georgia Peaches" on ''American Country New Year's Eve Live''.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2011/12/13/american-idol-lauren-alaina-fox-country-new-years-eve/|title=Exclusive: American Idol's Lauren Alaina Set for Fox's Countrified New Year's Eve Special|last=Slezak|first=Michael|website=TV Line|date=December 13, 2011|access-date=December 17, 2016|archive-date=November 29, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129142235/https://tvline.com/2011/12/13/american-idol-lauren-alaina-fox-country-new-years-eve/|url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-fox-new-years-live.htm|title=Lauren Alaina — Georgia Peaches — FOX New Years Live|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=January 1, 2012}} Alaina served as an opening act for [[Jason Aldean]]'s ''My Kinda Party Tour'' from January 20, 2012 to May 19, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-jason-aldean-2012-tour/|title=Lauren Joins Jason Aldean's 2012 Tour|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 2, 2011}} In addition to the ''My Kinda Party Tour'', Alaina opened for [[Sugarland]]'s ''In the Hands of the Fans Tour'' for a number of selected dates, beginning on April 5, 2012 and concluding on September 1, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.sugarlandmusic.com/news/64403/|title=Announcing the "In Your Hands" Tour 2012!|publisher=sugarlandmusic.com|date=February 29, 2012}} On March 8, 2012, Alaina performed "Georgia Peaches" on the [[American Idol (season 11)|eleventh season]] of ''American Idol''.{{cite web|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2012/03/17399-lauren-alaina-to-perform-georgia-peaches-on-idol|title=Lauren Alaina to Perform "Georgia Peaches" On Idol|work=Roughstock|publisher=Cheri Media|date=March 1, 2012}} On March 26, 2012, Alaina performed her single "Georgia Peaches" on ''The Today Show''.{{cite web|url=http://www.cambio.com/2012/03/22/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-today-show/|title=Lauren Alaina to Perform 'Georgia Peaches' on 'Today'|last=Cheung|first=Nadine|publisher=Cambio|date=March 22, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-georgia-peaches-today-show/|title=Lauren Alaina Brings Her 'Georgia Peaches' to the 'Today' Show|last=Cooper|first=Brittany|publisher=Taste of Country|date=March 26, 2012}} On June 16, 2012, Alaina headlined the final show of Riverbend, a music festival in her hometown of Chattanooga, Tennessee.{{cite news|url=http://timesfreepress.com/news/2012/jun/16/lauren-alaina-hometown-singer-closes-riverbend|title=Lauren Alaina returns to her roots at Riverbend|last=Pierce|first=Susan|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=June 16, 2012|access-date=June 16, 2012}} In July 2012, "[[Eighteen Inches]]" became Alaina's third single off her album, ''Wildflower''.{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-announces-new-single-18-inches-at-cma-fest-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Announces New Single "18 Inches" at CMA Fest (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 8, 2012|access-date=June 16, 2012}} The single was sent to country radio on July 16.{{cite web|url=http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/lauren-alaina-to-release-new-single-eighteen-inches-on-july-16|title=Lauren Alaina To Release New Single "Eighteen Inches" on July 16|last=Harr|first=Dan|publisher=Music News Nashville|date=June 29, 2012|access-date=September 28, 2016|archive-date=September 7, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180907110250/http://www.musicnewsnashville.com/lauren-alaina-to-release-new-single-eighteen-inches-on-july-16|url-status=dead}} "Eighteen Inches" hit number 37 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs list. In support of the song, Alaina embarked on an 18-city tour. Proceeds from each show benefited various local charities, including the [[Special Olympics]]. The Inch-By-Inch tour kicked off on September 21, 2012, and wrapped up November 12, 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/2012/sep/21/lauren-alaina-embarks-inch-inch-tour|title=Lauren Alaina embarks on Inch-By-Inch tour|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=September 21, 2012|access-date=September 21, 2012}} At the 2012 [[American Country Awards]], Alaina was selected as the New Artist of the Year.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alain-new-artist-of-the-year-2012-american-country-awards/|title=Lauren Alaina Snags New Artist of the Year at 2012 American Country Awards|last=Sciarretto|first=Amy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=December 10, 2012}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vRvdcM-frU|title=Lauren Alaina New artist of the year ACA 2012|date=December 14, 2012 |via=www.youtube.com}} ===2013–2017: ''Lauren Alaina'' EP and ''Road Less Traveled''=== In January 2013, Alaina started recording her second album.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-new-album/|title=Lauren Alaina Begins Work on New Album|last=Sciarretto|first=Amy|publisher=Taste of Country|date=January 21, 2013}} On May 7, 2013, Alaina released the single "[[Barefoot and Buckwild]]", which charted at thirty-four on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart. She performed the song on the [[American Idol (season 12)|twelfth season]] of ''American Idol'' on May 9, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/118154/lauren-alaina-to-perform-new-single-on-idol|title=Lauren Alaina To Perform New Single On Idol|publisher=allaccess.com|date=May 7, 2013|access-date=May 7, 2013}} In May 2013, Alaina also released a track titled "Antarctica: One World, One Family". The track serves as the theme song for the [[SeaWorld]] attraction [[Antarctica: Empire of the Penguin]].{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-sea-world-song/|title=Lauren Alaina Records Theme Song for SeaWorld Attraction|last=Whitaker|first=Sterling|publisher=Taste Of Country|date=May 11, 2013|access-date=May 14, 2013}} On December 10, 2013, Alaina released her cover of "My Grown Up Christmas List".{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/idolchatter/2013/12/09/lauren-alaina-grown-up-christmas-list-premiere/3910765|title=Premiere: Lauren Alaina's 'Grown-Up Christmas List'|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|work=Idol Chatter|publisher=USA Today|date=December 9, 2013}} On September 18, 2015, Alaina released the single "[[Next Boyfriend]]". "Next Boyfriend" was added to radio stations on September 28.{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-announces-ep-single-next-boyfriend-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Announces EP, Releases Single "Next Boyfriend" (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=September 18, 2015}} It reached number 39 on the ''Billboard'' Hot Country Songs chart. An ''[[Lauren Alaina (EP)|EP]]'' followed on October 2, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-to-release-self-titled-ep-october-2|title=LAUREN ALAINA TO RELEASE SELF-TITLED EP OCTOBER 2|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=September 18, 2015}} A track on the EP, "History" was used for [[ESPN]] College Football coverage.{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-writes-and-records-exclusive-track-for-espn|title=LAUREN ALAINA WRITES AND RECORDS EXCLUSIVE TRACK FOR ESPN|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=August 31, 2015}} Throughout 2016, Alaina opened for several shows on [[Alan Jackson]]'s Still Keepin' It Country Tour.{{cite web|url=http://www.alanjackson.com/news.html?n_id=4836|title=2016 Tour Dates Announced: Alan Jackson Keeps On "Keepin' It Country"|publisher=alanjackson.com|date=February 2, 2016}} On November 18, 2016, Alaina released her cover of "[[O Holy Night]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-shines-on-o-holy-night-available-now/|title=Lauren Alaina Shines On "O Holy Night" – Available Now|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=November 18, 2016}} Alaina released the single "[[Road Less Traveled (song)|Road Less Traveled]]", which she co-wrote with [[Meghan Trainor]] and [[Jesse Frasure]], on July 11, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://pressroom.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-encourages-others-with-her-brand-new-single-road-less-traveled/|title=Lauren Alaina Encourages Others With Her Brand New Single, 'Road Less Traveled.'|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 9, 2016}} Alaina performed the track on ''The Today Show'' on September 8, 2016{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/video/lauren-alaina-performs-new-single-road-less-traveled-760452675568|title=Lauren Alaina performs new single 'Road Less Traveled'|website=[[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]]|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=September 8, 2016}} and on ''[[Harry (talk show)|Harry]]'' on February 7, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/american-idol-lauren-alaina-cries-on-harry-video.htm|title=American Idol's Lauren Alaina Tearfully Shares Self Esteem Struggles on Harry (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=February 7, 2017}} In April 2017, "Road Less Traveled" reached number one on the ''Billboard'' [[Country Airplay]] chart. On January 27, 2017, Alaina released her second album ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]''.{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/lauren-alaina-road-less-traveled-album/|title=Lauren Alaina Shares 'Road Less Traveled' Album Release Details|last=Stefano|first=Angela|publisher=The Boot|date=December 5, 2016}} Tracks for Alaina's album include "Same Day Different Bottle",{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/lauren-alaina-same-day-different-bottle|title=Lauren Alaina Speaks Out About Father's Alcoholism in 'Same Day, Different Bottle'|website=The Boot|date=November 7, 2013}} "Doin' Fine",{{cite news|url=http://www.timesfreepress.com/news/local/story/2014/nov/20/lauren-alaina-named-one-countrys-most-beautiful-wo/275077|title=Lauren Alaina named one of 'Country's Most Beautiful Women'|newspaper=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=November 20, 2014}} "My Kinda People",{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTampyodErs| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/yTampyodErs| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina - My Kind of People (Acoustic)| date=May 14, 2015|via=www.youtube.com}}{{cbignore}} "Pretty",{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rxMOqGHKnHM| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/rxMOqGHKnHM| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Lauren Alaina singing "Pretty" 5-3-15|via=www.youtube.com}}{{cbignore}} "Crashin' the Boys Club" and "Queen of Hearts",{{cite web|url=http://www.mjsbigblog.com/lauren-alaina-performs-new-songs-at-cma-music-fest-video.htm|title=Lauren Alaina Performs New Songs at CMA Music Fest (VIDEO)|publisher=Mjsbigblog|date=June 15, 2015}} as well as four tracks from her self-titled EP. Alaina describes ''Road Less Traveled'' as "very different" from her debut album.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/lauren-alaina-new-music-vocal-cord-surgery/|title=Lauren Alaina on Her First Album After Vocal Cord Surgery: 'Very Different'|last=McClellan|first=Laura|publisher=Taste of Country|date=April 27, 2015|access-date=June 29, 2015}} In addition, self acceptance and love is a big theme on the album. "We are all different and that's what makes us all beautiful. The album will reflect that further. It will have some fun songs and sad songs – a little bit of what my life has been like over the past few years", Alaina says.{{cite news|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/856518|title='American Idol' runner-up Lauren Alaina is finishing her second album, working on a film|last=Gomez|first=Adrian|newspaper=Albuquerque Journal|date=September 30, 2016}} Alaina performed "Doin' Fine" on ''Good Morning America'' on January 31, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/photos/video-lauren-alaina-performs-doin-fine-live-gma-45164171|title=VIDEO: Lauren Alaina Performs 'Doin' Fine' Live on 'GMA'|website=[[Good Morning America]]|publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]]|date=January 31, 2017}} In February and March 2017, Alaina toured with Martina McBride on her Love Unleashed Tour.{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/martina-mcbride-partners-with-cmt-to-extend-love-unleashed-tour-into-2017/|title=Martina McBride Partners With CMT to Extend Love Unleashed Tour Into 2017|last=Stefano|first=Angela|publisher=The Boot|date=November 29, 2016|access-date=November 29, 2016}} Throughout June and July 2017, Alaina appeared on [[Luke Bryan]]'s ''Huntin', Fishin' and Lovin' Every Day Tour'' for a number of selected dates.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/news/luke-bryan-plots-massive-summer-tour-w462878|title=Luke Bryan Plots Massive Summer Tour|last=Crawford|first=Robert|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=January 25, 2017}} In May 2017, Alaina contributed guest vocals to the song "Are You Happy Now" from [[Rascal Flatts]]' tenth studio album, ''[[Back to Us]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/217734_exclusive_hear_rascal_flatts_soaring_duet_with_lauren_alaina_are_you_happy_now/|title=EXCLUSIVE: Hear Rascal Flatts' Soaring Duet With Lauren Alaina, 'Are You Happy Now'|last=Schillaci|first=Sophie|publisher=[[Entertainment Tonight]]|date=May 8, 2017}} Alaina's third single from ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]'', "Doin' Fine", was released May 22, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-sends-doin-fine-country-radio/|title=Lauren Alaina Sends 'Doin' Fine' To Country Radio|last=Laffer|first=Lauren|publisher=Sounds Like Nashville|date=May 8, 2017}} The song peaked at number 27 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay chart, making it her second-highest charting single. Alaina became the only female to top both country charts in 2017 after "Road Less Traveled" topped the Country Airplay chart and "What Ifs" topped the Hot Country chart. This also made her one of the only three women to top either country chart in 2017. Alaina performed "Doin' Fine" and "What Ifs" at the [[53rd Academy of Country Music Awards|2018 ACM Awards]] where she won the award for New Female Vocalist of the Year.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} At the 2018 [[CMT Music Awards]], Alaina and Brown won the award for "Best Collaborative Video" for "What Ifs" and were among the top five vote getters for "Video of the Year" for the same song.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} === 2018-present: ''Getting Good'', ''Getting Over Him'' EPs and ''Sitting Pretty on Top of the World'' === Alaina released the single, "Ladies in the '90s", on October 5, 2018. The song was released to country radio on October 15.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-releases-new-single-ladies-in-the-90s-today/|title=LAUREN ALAINA RELEASES NEW SINGLE "LADIES IN THE '90S" TODAY|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=October 5, 2018}} The single reached number 40 on the ''Billboard'' Country Airplay.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} Alaina was nominated for New Artist of the Year at the [[51st Annual Country Music Association Awards]] in 2017 and [[52nd Annual Country Music Association Awards]] in 2018. Throughout 2018 and 2019, Alaina toured with artists such as Alan Jackson, [[Cole Swindell]], [[Jason Aldean]], and [[Blake Shelton]].{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} She headlined numerous major music festivals such as [[Stagecoach Festival]].{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}} Alaina released the single, "[[Getting Good]]", on September 27, 2019. The song was released to country radio on October 7.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-is-getting-good-with-new-single-available-now/|title=LAUREN ALAINA IS "GETTING GOOD" WITH NEW SINGLE - AVAILABLE NOW|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=September 27, 2019}} "The Other Side" was released as a promotional single on October 22 and was danced to in a ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' episode in memory of her stepfather.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-performs-a-touching-tribute-and-debuts-new-song-the-other-side-on-abcs-dancing-with-the-stars/|title=LAUREN ALAINA PERFORMS A TOUCHING TRIBUTE AND DEBUTS NEW SONG "THE OTHER SIDE" ON ABC'S DANCING WITH THE STARS|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=October 22, 2019}} On March 6, 2020, she released the ''Getting Good'' EP including those two tracks and Ladies in the '90s.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alainas-getting-good-out-now/|title=LAUREN ALAINA's GETTING GOOD OUT NOW|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=March 6, 2020}} On September 4, 2020, she released the EP ''Getting Over Him''.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-getting-over-him-ep-coming-september-4/|title=LAUREN ALAINA GETTING OVER HIM EP COMING SEPTEMBER 4|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 29, 2020}} Alaina's first single from the EP, "[[Getting Over Him]]", featuring [[Jon Pardi]] was released on February 23, 2021.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alainas-getting-over-him-ft-jon-pardi-impacts-country-radio-today/|title=LAUREN ALAINA's "GETTING OVER HIM" FT JON PARDI IMPACTS COUNTRY RADIO TODAY|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=February 23, 2021}} Alaina released her third studio album, ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'', on September 3, 2021.{{cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/lauren-alaina-announces-sitting-pretty-on-top-of-the-world-album-out-sep-3/|title=LAUREN ALAINA ANNOUNCES SITTING PRETTY ON TOP OF THE WORLD ALBUM - OUT SEP. 3|publisher=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=July 30, 2021}} In March 2021, Alaina revealed that she had tested positive for [[COVID-19]].{{cite web|url= https://www.billboard.com/amp/articles/columns/country/9543923/lauren-alaina-covid-19-positive|title=Lauren Alaina Tests Positive for COVID-19|last=Iasimone|first=Ashley|publisher=Billboard|date=March 20, 2021}} On December 18, 2021, Alaina was asked to become an official member of [[The Grand Ole Opry]].{{Cite web|url=https://eu.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2021/12/18/lauren-alaina-invited-trisha-yearwood-become-newest-grand-ole-opry-member/8912891002/|title = Lauren Alaina invited to become newest Opry member: 'I've only cried that hard twice in my life'}} On July 25, 2022, Alaina signed with Big Loud Records.{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2022/07/lauren-alaina-signs-with-big-loud-records/ | title=Lauren Alaina Signs with Big Loud Records | date=July 25, 2022 }} ==Other ventures== In September and October 2016, Alaina filmed her very first movie ''The Road Less Traveled'', which took place in [[Knoxville, Tennessee]].{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7526452/lauren-alaina-american-idol-film-debut-road-less-traveled|title='American Idol' Alum Lauren Alaina to Make Film Debut in 'Road Less Traveled': Exclusive|last=Angermiller|first=Michele|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 29, 2016}} The film was released on June 6, 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071Z2DLS8|title=Road Less Traveled|website=Amazon}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y8Fk3bqjl4Q| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211118/y8Fk3bqjl4Q| archive-date=2021-11-18 | url-status=live|title=Road Less Traveled - Official Trailer - MarVista Entertainment| website=[[YouTube]]|date=May 23, 2017}}{{cbignore}} It then premiered on [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]] on November 10, 2017.[https://www.thecountrynote.com/in-the-news/cmt-debut-lauren-alainas-romantic-comedy-road-less-traveled-november-10/ CMT To Debut Lauren Alaina’s Romantic Comedy “Road Less Traveled” On November 10] ''The Country Note'', October 16, 2017 In August 2019, Alaina was announced as one of the celebrities to compete on [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 28)|season 28]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''.{{cite web|last=Thorbecke|first=Catherine|title=''Dancing With the Stars'' 2019: Hannah Brown, Karamo Brown, Lamar Odom and more to compete on new season|url=https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/culture/story/dancing-stars-2019-hannah-brown-karamo-brown-lamar-65080101|work=[[Good Morning America]]|date=August 21, 2019|access-date=November 26, 2019}} She made it to the finals and finished in fourth place.{{cite news|url=https://www.goldderby.com/article/2019/dancing-with-the-stars-finale-recap-live-blog-dwts-news/|title='Dancing with the Stars' Finale recap: Who won the Mirror Ball Trophy at the end of topsy-turvy season 28?|last=Montgomery|first=Daniel|date=November 25, 2019|access-date=November 26, 2019|work=[[Gold Derby]]}} In 2021, Alaina starred in the film, ''Roadhouse Romance,'' which premiered on September 11, 2021.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2021/06/roadhouse-romance-lauren-alaina-tyler-hynes-hallmark-rom-com-to-kick-off-fall-harvest-programming-event-1234773436/|title='Roadhouse Romance': Lauren Alaina & Tyler Hynes Hallmark Rom-Com To Kick Off "Fall Harvest" Programming Event|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=June 14, 2021}} She was a contestant on ''[[Beyond the Edge (TV series)|Beyond the Edge]]'', a survival competition series that premiered in March 2022. She tore her ligament, ending her time on the show, later admitting that her exit was the right call.{{cite web |last=Schneider |first=Michael |title=CBS' 'Beyond the Edge' Sent Celebrities to the Jungle — And Producers Were Terrified They'd All Quit |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/beyond-the-edge-cbs-celebrity-survivor-2-1235206708/ |website=Variety |access-date=March 16, 2022 |date=March 16, 2022}} ==Personal life== Alaina's parents divorced in 2013. Her father was a recovering alcoholic who got sober in October 2013. Both her parents remarried.{{cite news|url=https://parade.com/541082/alison-abbey/with-a-new-album-and-a-top-20-single-country-singer-lauren-alaina-is-doin-fine/|title=With a New Album and a Top 20 Single, Country Singer Lauren Alaina Is 'Doin' Fine'|last=Abbey|first=Alison|newspaper=Parade: Entertainment, Recipes, Health, Life, Holidays |date=January 20, 2017}} In 2018, her stepfather died from cancer. Her father died in 2024.{{cite news |last1=Simpson |first1=Kaitlin |title=Country Singer Lauren Alaina’s Father Dies 6 Years After Her Stepfather Lost Battle With Cancer |url=https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lauren-alaina-cancels-concerts-after-fathers-death/ |access-date=24 September 2024 |publisher=Us Weekly |date=July 24, 2024}} Throughout her teen years, Alaina struggled with [[bulimia]].{{cite web|url=http://motto.time.com/4324775/american-idol-lauren-alaina-bulimia/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160521000818/http://motto.time.com/4324775/american-idol-lauren-alaina-bulimia/|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 21, 2016|title=American Idol Star Lauren Alaina Opens Up About Her Past Struggles With Body Image and Bulimia|last=Amburg|first=Jessie|date=May 10, 2016}} She said in a 2016 ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' interview, "I had an eating disorder for like four years, and I was just lost" and "I found myself in these last few years, through music and family and good people around me."{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/lauren-alaina-on-how-eating-disorder-led-to-redemptive-new-song-20160708|title=Lauren Alaina on How Eating Disorder Led to Redemptive New Song|last=Freeman|first=Jon|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=July 8, 2016}}{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7468472/lauren-alaina-literally-finds-her-voice-on-road-less-traveled|title=Lauren Alaina Literally Finds Her Voice On 'Road Less Traveled|last=Rowland|first=Tom|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=August 10, 2016}} Alaina is a [[Christians|Christian]] and often states that she lives for Jesus Christ.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/American-Idol-Lauren-Alaina-1033491.aspx|title=American Idol's Lauren Alaina on Vocal Problems: I Knew God Would Get Me Through It|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|magazine=TV Guide|date=May 24, 2011}} In 2012, Alaina began dating Alexander Hopkins.{{cite web|url=http://rare.us/story/american-idol-alum-lauren-alaina-turns-up-the-heat-in-her-latest-video/|title="American Idol" alum Lauren Alaina turns up the heat in her latest video|last=Churilla|first=Ken|publisher=Rare Country|date=January 16, 2016}} In July 2018, the couple announced that they had become engaged.{{cite magazine|url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-engaged-boyfriend-alex-hopkins/|title=Lauren Alaina and Alex Hopkins Are Engaged: 'Being Yours Forever Has a Nice RING to It'|last=Pasquini|first=Maria|magazine=People|date=July 21, 2018}} In January 2019, they announced that they had split after six years.{{cite tweet|user=Lauren_Alaina|author=Lauren Alaina|number=1087511481934065665|date=January 21, 2019|title=We ask for grace, compassion, and respect in this time. I don't regret a single second with Alex. I wish him the very best. Please do the same.}} She was in a relationship with comedian [[John Crist (comedian)|John Crist]] for several months in 2019.{{cite magazine |last=Mizoguchi |first=Karen |title=Lauren Alaina Reveals She and Boyfriend John Crist Split Ahead of Her Dancing with the Stars Debut |url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-john-crist-split-ahead-of-her-dancing-with-the-stars-debut/ |magazine=People |date=September 16, 2019|access-date=September 17, 2019}} In November 2022, she announced her engagement to Cam Arnold.{{Cite web |title=Lauren Alaina Announces Engagement Onstage at the Opry: 'Make Some Noise for My Future Husband' |url=https://people.com/country/lauren-alaina-engaged-to-cam-arnold-opry-announcement/ |access-date=2022-11-20 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}} The couple married on February 4, 2024.{{Cite web |title=Lauren Alaina Marries Cam Arnold in 'Big, Loud' Nashville Wedding: 'We Have a Lot of People Who Love Us' |url=https://people.com/lauren-alaina-marries-cam-arnold-big-loud-wedding-nashville-8553175 |access-date=2024-02-06 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}} ==Discography== {{main|Lauren Alaina discography}} '''Studio albums''' * ''[[Wildflower (Lauren Alaina album)|Wildflower]]'' (2011) * ''[[Road Less Traveled (Lauren Alaina album)|Road Less Traveled]]'' (2017) * ''[[Sitting Pretty on Top of the World]]'' (2021) ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! Year ! Award ! Category ! Nominee / Work ! Result !
